intro: Harveya alba, commonly known as the white harveya, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant produces showy, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. Harveya alba is characterized by its evergreen foliage and compact growth habit. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires a cool, humid environment to flourish.
